EAD201.name: Current Issues in Education
EAD201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
EAD201.description: Contemporary and perennial issues in elementary, secondary, and higher education.

EAD315.name: Student Leadership Training
EAD315.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
EAD315.description: Student leadership role, skills, and technique, consistent with the principles and demands of a democratic multicultural society.

EAD361.name: Educational Reform and Policy Analysis
EAD361.description: Analysis of prominent current K-12 and higher educational reforms and policies in the United States.

EAD362.name: Student Culture and Higher Education
EAD362.description: Historical and contemporary college student cultures in U.S. and global contexts.

EAD363.name: Diversity and Higher Education
EAD363.description: Historical and contemporary aspects of diversity and multiculturalism in higher education.

EAD491.name: Special Topics in Student Affairs
EAD491.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD491.description: Introduction to the student affairs profession and field.
EAD491.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores and not open to master's students in the Higher, Adult, and Lifelong Education Major or in the Student Affairs Administration Major.

EAD800A.name: Professional Seminar in Educational Leadership
EAD800A.description: Fundamentals of school leadership. Enduring problems in educational administration. Program orientation, including organizing perspectives and expectations for students. Technological tools and resources for learning.

EAD801.name: Leadership and Organizational Development
EAD801.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD801.description: Interaction of leadership with organizational culture and development within a variety of educational organizations.

EAD805.name: Administration in Higher Education
EAD805.description: Theories, systems, structures, and processes of college and universities. Comparison of the organization, leadership, and governance of higher education institutions to other non-profit organizations.

EAD806.name: Evolving Practice of School Leaders
EAD806.description: Historical analysis of K-12 school leadership. Comparative analysis of leadership and school improvement. Leadership theory. Ethical leadership. Critical thinking and reflection of one's own leadership.
EAD806.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the K-12 Educational Administration major.

EAD811.name: Inquiry and Analysis of Teaching and Learning
EAD811.description: Inquiry and applied research methods and skills. Data-based decision making for instructional improvement. Computer skills for data analysis. Methods of data use for teachers and leaders. Legal and ethical use of data.

EAD812.name: Inquiry and Analysis of School Organizations
EAD812.description: Inquiry and applied research methods and skills. Data-based decision making for organizational improvement. Analyzing schools as rational, natural, and open systems. Methods of data use for school administration. Legal and ethical concerns of data use.

EAD820.name: School Leadership Internship
EAD820.description: Supervised internship in an educational institution focused on school leadership issues.
EAD820.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the K-12 Educational Administration major.

EAD821.name: Internship in Educational Administration II
EAD821.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD821.description: Supervised internship in an educational and/or community organization focused on school-community leadership issues.
EAD821.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in K-12 Educational Administration.

EAD822.name: Engaging Diverse Students and Families
EAD822.description: Comparative and historical analysis of education within the broader social, cultural, and linguistic contexts of schools. Students in contemporary schools. Social problems, social policies, and school practice. School, family, and community relationships.

EAD824.name: Leading Teacher Learning
EAD824.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD824.description: Instructional leadership. Learning environment for teachers and students. Teacher supervision and evaluation. Staff development and teacher collaboration. Improvement of instructional program. Assessing student achievement.

EAD830.name: Issues in Urban Education: Racial Achievement Gap
EAD830.description: Institutional, class, race systemic factors that contribute to the racial achievement gap. Strategies for improving urban schools; uncover areas of study for future research.

EAD840.name: Inquiry in Postsecondary Education
EAD840.description: Inquiry concepts and methods related to postsecondary education; problems of theory and practice in teaching and learning, administration, and leadership.

EAD850.name: Issues and Strategies in Multicultural Education
EAD850.description: Historical, pedagogical, and administrative considerations of multicultural education in K-16 educational settings.

EAD852.name: The School Principalship
EAD852.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
EAD852.description: Administration of K-12 schools. Alternative organizational arrangements, curricula, and practices. Problems and strategies for improving schools.

EAD853.name: Education Finance and Policy
EAD853.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
EAD853.description: Alternative policies to fund public schools. Equity and adequacy in school finance. Cost-effective education practices. Privatization of education service provision.

EAD860.name: Concept of a Learning Society
EAD860.description: Learning in the Knowledge Age with special focus on the role of technology as a partner in the learning process and in extending intelligence.

EAD861.name: Adult Learning
EAD861.description: Learning and change in the adult years. Motivation and barriers to participation. Cognitive, emotional, developmental, and socio-cultural processes involved in adult learning. Understanding differences among adults in approaches to learning.

EAD863.name: Training and Professional Development
EAD863.description: Design of training and professional development programs for postsecondary education contexts.

EAD864.name: Adult Career Development
EAD864.description: Psychological, social and institutional elements of careers. Cases and theories of career and adult development in the context of changing conditions of work and learning across the life-span.

EAD866.name: Teaching in Postsecondary Education
EAD866.description: Philosophies and beliefs undergirding teaching strategies. Effective teaching strategies and formal learning environments. Assessment of teaching and of student learning.

EAD867.name: Case Studies in Educational Leadership
EAD867.description: Case-based learning to examine contemporary K-16 leadership.

EAD868.name: Pro-Seminar in Higher and Adult Education
EAD868.description: Foundations and development of higher and adult education as a professional discipline. Traditional and contemporary issues in theory, research, and practice.
EAD868.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Higher, Adult, and Lifelong Education major.

EAD870.name: Foundations of Postsecondary Education
EAD870.description: Historical, philosophical and social forces that shaped development of colleges and universities. Emphasis on higher education in the United States.

EAD871.name: Collegiate Contexts for Teaching and Learning
EAD871.description: Sociocultural contexts of teaching and learning in collegiate environments. Organizational strategies to improve learning contexts for diverse students.

EAD872.name: Legal Issues in Higher Education
EAD872.description: Legal aspects of administrative practice in institutions of higher education. Governance, academic freedom, due process, and anti-discrimination.

EAD873.name: College Student Development
EAD873.description: Research, theory, and literature related to student development in the college years.
EAD873.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Student Affairs Administration major.

EAD874.name: Introduction to Student Affairs
EAD874.description: History, development, philosophy, organization, and administration of college student personnel as a profession. Needed services, programs and skills.
EAD874.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Student Affairs Administration major.

EAD875.name: Issues and Strategies in Student Affairs
EAD875.description: Student affairs work in colleges and universities. Integration of theory with practice.
EAD875.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Student Affairs Administration major.

EAD876.name: Budgeting and Finance in Higher Education
EAD876.description: Fundamentals of higher education budgeting and finance, including external sources of funding, internal resource allocation processes, social and economic principles and values regarding the distribution of resources among competing concerns.

EAD877.name: Program Planning and Evaluation in Postsecondary Contexts
EAD877.description: Planning and evaluating programs for learning in diverse educational contexts.

EAD878.name: Education in the Digital Age
EAD878.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
EAD878.description: An exploration of the historical, philosophical, critical, and practical questions associated with the technological transformation of all levels of education.

EAD881.name: Workshops in Educational Administration
EAD881.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD881.description: Laboratory experiences focused on common supervisory and administrative problems.

EAD882.name: Seminars in Educational Administration
EAD882.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD882.description: Seminars in various fields in K-12 educational administration and in higher, adult, and lifelong education.

EAD889.name: Research and Assessment in Student Affairs
EAD889.description: Introduction to strategies for research and inquiry in student affairs.
EAD889.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Student Affairs Administration major.

EAD890.name: Independent Study
EAD890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD890.description: Individual study in an area of K-12 administration or higher, adult, and lifelong education.

EAD893.name: Professional Development Seminar in Student Affairs
EAD893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD893.description: Supervised work experience in student affairs.
EAD893.restrictions: Open to students in the Student Affairs Administration major.

EAD894.name: Laboratory and Field Experiences
EAD894.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD894.description: Supervised graduate practica, observations, internships, or externships in K-12 administration and in higher, adult, and lifelong education.

EAD895.name: Research Ethics
EAD895.description: Identifying and resolving ethical problems in research. Collegial interactions. Authorship, publication, and reviewing practices. Data management. Ownership of data and intellectual property. Conflicts of interest. Protection of human and animal subjects. Lab safety and compliance.

EAD899.name: Master's Thesis Research
EAD899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

EAD901.name: Urban Education: An Historical Overview
EAD901.description: Emergence and evolution of urban schools. Social, economic, and political factors affecting their development.

EAD907.name: Educational Policy for Immigrant and English Language Learner Students
EAD907.description: Impact of recent increases in immigration on racial, ethnic, and linguistic diversity in schools in the United States. Contemporary education policy issues that affect immigrant and ELL students. Language learning policy. Social context of education for immigrant and ELL students.

EAD920.name: Political Economy of Schooling
EAD920.description: Impacts of education on economic outcomes; impacts of student socioeconomic status on school outcomes. Multiple goals of public education. Historical development of public school system. Workplace skills, occupational structure, social mobility. School governance and education politics. Alternative policies to improve education outcomes.

EAD921.name: Educational Leadership and Transformation
EAD921.description: Creating organizational value through leadership. Leading through conflict. Personal and collective leadership development. Connecting schools with civic life. Convening community groups for democratic deliberation.
EAD921.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Educational Leadership Major.

EAD922.name: Analyzing Education Systems
EAD922.description: Analyzing systems of educational organizations, including schools, local education agencies, and state education agencies. Theory and research on educational organizations to actual cases in order to identify interdependent strengths and weaknesses that support and/or undermine instructional improvement.

EAD923.name: Organizing for Learning
EAD923.description: Curriculum leadership. Competing approaches to curriculum and pedagogy. Ensuring instructional program coherence. Managing and evaluation of human resources. Planning and coordinating professional development. Implementing systemic use of instructional technology.

EAD924.name: Data and Decisions
EAD924.description: Data collection and analysis for school improvement. Decision making criteria. Assessment of resource use and instructional learning outcomes. Data management. Legal and ethical use of data. Communication strategies.
EAD924.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Educational Leadership Major.

EAD925.name: Policy and Practice in Education
EAD925.description: Multiple conceptions of the relationship between policy and practice in K-12 education.

EAD926.name: School Finance and Operations
EAD926.description: School funding and resource allocation. Alternative employee compensation and service delivery options. School facilities; safe and healthy school environments.

EAD928.name: Proseminar in Educational Policy
EAD928.description: Disciplinary perspectives on policy issues. Influence of research on policy process. Politics and educational practice as determinents of policy choice.

EAD929.name: Collaborative Inquiry
EAD929.description: Designing and implementing school or community-based action research. Collaborative, multi-disciplinary inquiry. Democratic and civic engagement. Ethics of collaborative research. Reflective practice. Moving from inquiry to action.

EAD931.name: Introduction to Qualitative Methods in Educational Research
EAD931.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD931.description: Concepts and assumptions underlying multiple traditions of qualitative research methods in education. Relationship between research questions and qualitative research design. Epistemology, methods, and ethical issues of ethnography, case study research, grounded theory, oral history and discourse analysis. Criteria for appraising and critiquing qualitative research designs, claims, and evidence,

EAD942.name: Economics of Education
EAD942.description: Economic effects of education. Economic analysis of policy issues in education. Applications to the United States and other countries.

EAD943.name: Politics of Education
EAD943.description: Politics of education in the United States. Interplay of key institutions (e.g., school boards, state governments, Congress, mayors) and actors (e.g. elected officials, parents, teachers unions, and the general public) shaping the public education system.

EAD944.name: Social Context of Education
EAD944.description: Evolution of educational institutions and practices in response to economic, political, demographic and social change. Legacies of change for instruction, curriculum, segmentation of students, and students’ school experiences. Effect of family and community on students and schools. Conflicting goals/purposes of public education. Struggles for educational equity and opportunity.

EAD946A.name: Regression Analysis for Education Policy
EAD946A.description: Foundations of regression analysis. Underlying assumptions. Applications to education policy with attention to challenges of establishing causal relations. STATA software skills for independent scholarly investigations.

EAD946B.name: Econometric Analysis for Education Policy
EAD946B.description: Econometric techniques for identifying and estimating causal relationships for education policy analysis.Extensions of linear regression analysis. Evaluation of randomized control trials.

EAD947.name: Comparative International Education Policy
EAD947.description: International and comparative education policy. National and international policy actors. Cross-national education policy research. Insights from international research for U.S. education policy.

EAD948.name: Advanced Economics of Education
EAD948.description: Advanced research in the intersection of economics and education. Returns to education, education production,school choice, teacher quality and compensation, financial aid, and postsecondary access.

EAD949.name: Advanced Seminar in Education Policy
EAD949.description: Seminars on rotating topics in advanced, contemporary education policy research.

EAD950A.name: Proseminar I in K-12 Educational Administration
EAD950A.description: Disciplinary perspectives of K-12 educational leadership and management. Influence of research on leadership practice.

EAD950B.name: Proseminar II in K-12 Educational Administration
EAD950B.description: Synthesis and analysis of disciplinary perspectives of K-12 educational leadership and management. Influence of research on leadership practice.

EAD952A.name: Externship in Educational Administration
EAD952A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
EAD952A.description: Current administrative problems and solution strategies in education.

EAD955B.name: Field Research Methods in Educational Administration
EAD955B.description: Methods used in conducting field studies in educational organizations, with emphasis on interviews, observation, and participant observation.

EAD960.name: Proseminar in Postsecondary Education
EAD960.description: Questions, trends, issues and resources in higher, adult, and lifelong education. Development of skills in problem identification, literature analysis, and scholarly writing.
EAD960.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the Higher, Adult, and Lifelong Education major.

EAD963.name: Leadership in Postsecondary Education
EAD963.description: Leadership as a complex social phenomenon in higher, adult, and lifelong educational settings. Interdisciplinary theories of leadership as applied to postsecondary education.

EAD964.name: Comparative Higher Education
EAD964.description: National systems of higher education, policy challenges, international and comparative research.

EAD965.name: Diversity and Equity in Postsecondary Education
EAD965.description: Promise, challenge, and management of diversity and equity in higher education. Analysis of data and policy. Management responses and strategies.

EAD966.name: Students in Postsecondary Education
EAD966.description: Research and theoretical foundations concerning traditional and non-traditional college students. Literature from diverse fields such as higher education, adult learning, and multicultural education. Psychosocial and cognitive development of college students, learning and development across the life-span, experiences of diverse populations, impact of collegiate environments and structures on students.
EAD966.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the Higher, Adult, and Lifelong Education major.

EAD967.name: Policy Development and Analysis in Postsecondary Education
EAD967.description: Higher education policy issues, policy-related research and development approaches.
EAD967.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the Higher, Adult, and Lifelong Education major.

EAD968.name: Teaching, Learning, and Curriculum in Postsecondary Education
EAD968.description: Theories and current issues about teaching, learning, and curriculum in postsecondary education. Topics include learning contexts, learners, teachers, the learning process, curriculum.
EAD968.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the Higher, Adult, and Lifelong Education major.

EAD970.name: Organization and Administration in Postsecondary Education
EAD970.description: Principles and patterns of organization and governance characteristic of colleges and universities. Administrative, trustee, faculty, and student roles.
EAD970.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the Higher, Adult, and Lifelong Education major.

EAD972.name: International and Comparative Issues in Higher and Adult Education
EAD972.description: Higher and adult education in international contexts. Policy, organizational structures and behavior, curriculum, pedagogy, and student affairs.

EAD980.name: Engaged Educational Leadership
EAD980.description: Developing skills for engaged leadership. Convening forums to discuss and disseminate ideas for improvement of educational organizations and educational policy. Developing leadership skills that encourage and support agency of stakeholders.

EAD982A.name: Capstone Seminar
EAD982A.description: Capstone seminar to support ongoing work for capstone projects.

EAD990.name: Independent Study
EAD990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD990.description: Advanced individual study in an area of K-12 administration or higher, adult, and lifelong education.

EAD991A.name: Special Topics in K-12 Administration
EAD991A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

EAD991B.name: Special Topics in Higher, Adult, and Lifelong Education
EAD991B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD991B.description: Special topics in the field of higher, adult and lifelong education.

EAD991C.name: Special Topics in Education Policy
EAD991C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

EAD994.name: Laboratory and Field Experience in Educational Administration
EAD994.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD994.description: Supervised advanced graduate practica, observations, internships, or externships in K-12 administration and in higher, adult, and lifelong education.

EAD995.name: Research Practicum in Educational Administration
EAD995.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD995.description: Supervised research practicum. Design, execution, analysis, presentation, critique, and revision of research projects.
EAD995.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the College of Education. Approval of department.

EAD999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
EAD999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EAD999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Education or in the Department of Educational Administration.
